utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, we’re about to shoot this scene in the movie where the killer ape DNA is slowly taking over my body.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But I realize they’re gluing fur everywhere except my cleavage. So, I asked the director why and he says, it’s important to the story that my boobs be the last things to turn ape.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s sweet that he thinks there’s a story.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, and there’s not even a bathroom on set. I have to go to the gas station across the street. I mean, I was dressed like half an ape and still not even close to the most disgusting person in there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I could use your assistance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now that I’ve given up string theory, I’m struggling to find my next area of focus. So, in your professional opinion, which of these areas do you think is the most promising?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh, well, I think there’s some really innovative stuff going on in dark matter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s helpful. Okay. Of these four areas…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, what did we say about being a nicer friend?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, what did we say about being a gullible weenie?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is just so frustrating.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: ‘Cause you’re trying too hard. You need to do something else, get your mind off it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. How about we bring back Anything Can Happen Thursdays?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, that’s good. Why’d you guys stop doing that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You made fun of us. Said it was stupid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Sounds like me. Come on, Sheldon. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. I officially reinstate Anything Can Happen Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great, what do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know. What do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. What do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m starting to remember the problem with Anything Can Happen Thursdays.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm, what can we do that’s fun?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What can we do that’s different?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What can we do that’s free?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, got it. We order a pizza.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you kidding? That’s what you always do. Think harder.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right. You’re right. Got it. We order calzones, cut them open, eat them like pizza. All right, all right, I’ll shake the brain bush one more time, see what falls out. Got it. There’s a live-action role-playing group that meets every Thursday night in Griffith Park and re-enacts battles from Lord of the Rings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, tell me more about this calzone idea.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t we just ease into this. Let, let’s go for a walk and, and, and see if we find a new restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Any chance that restaurant is near Griffith Park?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj and Howard are at Howard’s mom’s, but should we call the girls and see if they want to come?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Bernadette’s working late.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy’s sick.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw. What’s wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, she talks a lot. She always wants to hold hands.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not what I meant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if you were referring to her illness your question should have been, what ails her?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What ails her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Who knows?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, anything can happen. We can push him down the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey. Thanks for coming to hang out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No problem. How’s your mom feeling?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, but she’d feel better if she took her medicine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, when Cinnamon won’t take her medicine, I hide it in a piece of cheese.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good idea. We can wrap the pill in cheese, feed it to Cinnamon, and then my mom can eat Cinnamon. So what do you feel like doing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was thinking we could watch a DVD.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, my mom doesn’t have a lot to choose from. Unless you want to watch the video of her colonoscopy. Spoiler alert, 20 minutes in they find a prune pit.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, how do you feel about watching House of 1000 Corpses?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A straight-up gore-fest? You hate this stuff.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I do, but for some reason, Emily loves it and wants to watch it with me tomorrow, so I thought if I start with you first, then I could act cool about it with her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s actually not a bad plan. I can sit through the colonoscopy now, but that first time I was like, oh my God, a prune pit.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, so, you’ll watch it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re a good friend. I owe you one.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard. Help me get out of the tub.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not that one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, we’re just randomly choosing a restaurant without researching it online?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. You know, this is how Anything Can Happen Thursday turns into It Won’t Stop Coming Up Friday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, how about that Asian fusion place?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fusion and Asians? I’m trying not to think about science.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell? What? She’s not working late.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And Amy doesn’t look sick.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why would they lie to us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a good question. Amy and Bernadette. Amy and Bernadette. Amy and Bernadette. Why did you lie to us?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey. Listen to this. Murder, cannibalism and satanic rituals are just a few of the thousand plus horrors that await.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I just helped my mom out of the tub, so, I’m one slippery horror ahead of you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re a good son. I don’t know how you do it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Beach blankets, my friend, it’s all about beach blankets.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right, let’s get this over with. Ew, it’s got someone’s hair on it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, you’re gonna do great with this movie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re not working late. Why did you lie to me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And Amy, you told me you were sick, but you look just as pale and tired as always.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I just needed a break from hearing you obsess about what to do after string theory.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We kind of just wanted one night where we didn’t have to hear about how miserable you are making this movie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But none of that means we don’t love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I haven’t been complaining that much about the movie. Have I?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I also love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well you know what? Maybe I need a break from all of you. Come on, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re gonna have Anything Can Happen Thursday, you’re gonna tell me all about your science stuff and I’m gonna complain about my movie, and we’re gonna support each other because that’s what friends do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. ‘Cause if I had to pick now, I’d probably go with dark matter because…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand my food. Chinese noodles with Korean barbecue in a taco.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s fusion.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My mother would lock her car doors if she had to drive through this hodgepodge of ethnicity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Think I’ve been complaining too much about the movie?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But to be fair, when you talk, most of what you say sounds like, wah, wah, wah, clothes, wah, wah, wah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I don’t understand why you’re not upset with Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am. So much so that I’m gonna bring her here for dinner on our next date night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. So, in the last 20 minutes, we’ve seen a crazy woman kissing a fetus in a jar. We’ve seen a guy cut in half and sewn to a fish.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And the brutal dismemberment of a rotisserie chicken by my mother.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: On the bright side, she didn’t even notice the pill. Why does Emily like this stuff? Do you think there’s something psychologically wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, she could have a freezer full of ex-boyfriend’s body parts and you’d still go out with her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I do like that the ex-boyfriend’s out of the picture.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I feel so bad about lying to Sheldon. How am I gonna make it up to him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’d tell you what I do with Howard, but I don’t think dressing up like a Catholic schoolgirl is gonna work with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’d probably give you homework.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did you lie to Howard about tonight?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And you don’t feel guilty about it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Between Penny’s gorilla movie and Howard’s gorilla mother, I had no choice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thankfully Penny and I have a relationship based on honesty. What? I don’t lie to her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, we know you don’t lie to her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you. Hey, maybe the answer to your career question is in one of these.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, there’s only one cookie with something in the middle that solves life’s problems, and that’s an Oreo. Or a Nutter Butter, if you’re in a pinch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, open it. I bet it says something great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Asian fusion. For all you know, there’s a tiny Chihuahua in here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll go. Hmm. People turn to you for guidance and wisdom. Yeah, that’s a good one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How is that not good?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Turn to you for wisdom? Clearly, that cookie is mocking you. You’d never hear that kind of sass from a Nutter Butter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, since you’re paying for dinner, I’ll let that slide. Open yours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you ever paid for a meal?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not with money. Read.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your warm and fun-loving nature delights those around you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, try again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let me get this straight. So, he kills this girl’s father, cuts off the guy’s face, and is wearing it as a mask while he makes out with her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m just gonna say it. That’s not okay. Why can’t I be in a relationship with a girl who likes The Sound of Music?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj, you are the girl in the relationship who likes The Sound of Music. Hey, Penny. What’s up? No, Bernie’s working late. Really? Thanks for telling me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m having sex with a Catholic schoolgirl tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I think I see our next stop.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can’t be serious. If I wanted to waste my time on nonsense, I’d follow Leonard on Instagram.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, come on, tonight we are trying new things.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. That’s a lot of incense. Or someone set a hippie on fire.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (on phone)
utterance.content: Yeah, honey, I’m still stuck at work. Really? Penny said that? Okay, it’s true. I’m sorry. I’ll see you at home. Yeah, yeah, I’ll put it on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You and I never just hang out like this. Why is that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know, it’s weird, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. We should do it more often.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, no. I mean, this is weird right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, it’s Penny.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is she still mad?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, doesn’t seem like it. She got Sheldon to go to a psychic with her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A psychic? He considers them not just mumbo jumbo, but extra-jumbo mumbo jumbo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, Penny can be very persuasive. She’s gotten me to do a lot of things I wouldn’t normally do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because she has sex with you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, she does.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can I confess something? Once in a while, I get a little jealous of how close Penny and Sheldon are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I mean, not in a romantic way. It’s just, she really has some sort of connection with him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, well they’ve known each other a long time, and Penny grew up around horses, so she knows how to approach him without making him skittish.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t get me wrong, I’m glad they’re friends. I just wish he’d be that comfortable around me already.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it took him a long time to get comfortable around me, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Something terrible in a former life? I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I gotta go. Penny ratted me out. FYI, she’s getting you a watch for your birthday with money she took out of your wallet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t mean to be rude or discourteous, but before we begin, I’d just like to say there is absolutely no scientific evidence to support clairvoyance of any kind. Which means, and again, no insult intended, that you’re a fraud, your profession is a swindle, and, uh, your livelihood is dependent on the gullibility of stupid people. Again, no offence.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, just ask your question.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I just did. What was it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, for God’s sake. Look, he’s a physicist who’s trying to figure out what his next field of study should be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For your information, I was asking her about the next Star Trek movie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I can answer that one, I’ll be bored.

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: All right, why don’t we begin? Your spirit guides are telling me that there’s a woman in your life you’re having problems with.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s an easy guess. I’m clearly an annoying person and have problems with both genders.

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: Yes, you clearly are. But I’m seeing a specific woman that you’re in a romantic relationship with.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, oh, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: Does she have dark hair?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, yes, your spirit guides are on fire.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The majority of people have dark hair. Even you, at one time.

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: Does she work in a similar field to you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ha. The opposite. She’s a neurobiologist, and I’m a theoretical physicist. My spirit guides can go suck an egg.

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: They’re telling me that you have difficulty being close with her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, he does. He so does. What should he do?

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: He should give himself to this relationship. Once he does, all his other pursuits will come into focus.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you hear that? I mean, Amy is the key to your happiness.

utterance.speaker: Psychic
utterance.content: Exactly. Personally and professionally. Everything will fall into place once you commit to her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what this is? Yeah, and I reserve this word for those rare instances when it’s truly deserved. This is malarkey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, you really struck a nerve. I’ve never heard him use the M word before.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here we go, House of a 1,000 Corpses.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Now, just so you know, I was a nanny for three years, so if you get scared, I can totally change your diaper.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, I have to tell you something. These kind of movies really aren’t my thing, so, last night, I watched it just to see what I was getting myself into.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I have to be honest, I thought it was disturbing and weird, and it made me wonder what it says about someone who enjoys it.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I wonder that, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then, why do you watch these things?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Can I tell you something without you judging me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: They kind of turn me on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And play.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. I didn’t expect you this evening.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I was just feeling so bad about lying to you the other night, I wanted to make it up to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And how do you propose to do that? Unless you have Gravity on Blu-ray under that skirt, I don’t know where you’re going with this.
